item.title: Bcel Help?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Hmm, for integers from 0 to 5 you should use ICONST_0 to ICONST_5 and instantly after you define the value you call ISTORE with the appropriate variable index. Make sure you update your locals afterwards. (btw, for integer values use IADD) Tbh, I’m not quite sure why you’d be adding up 2 numbers though, you can just push the result as ICONST_5… That’s how java’s compiler would do it…

EDIT: You should only ever use ADD to add one variable to another really, because for adding or subtracting a number from a variable you should use the IINC instruction.

Read full topic

item.title: Bcel Help?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Justin186:

Why Invokestatic though? Why wont InvokeVirtual do?

INVOKEVIRTUAL invokes a dynamic method, you’re trying to invoke a static method.

Read full topic

item.title: Bcel Help?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Hmm, you should build it like this I think:
ACONST_NULL
ALOAD0
INVOKESTATIC JOptionPane.showMessageDialog
RETURN

That should call showMessageDialog with null as first parameter and your string argument in the method as second parameter…

EDIT:
Btw, you’re using ALOAD0 here because it’s a static method, so ALOAD0 is the first argument where as with a member it is “this”.

Read full topic

item.title: Bcel Help?
item.dc:creator: @Justin186 Justin186
item.description:
@Justin186 wrote:

Okay So I just started learning BCEL
For now im just messing around with a “Hello World” Class
Now what I’m doing is adding a method to it, this is what the method is
But the method doesn’t pass the paramaters i want… I’m pushing a component and a string into the stack…
I want it to call JDialog.showMessageDialog(Component, String)

InstructionList il = new InstructionList();
		InstructionFactory ifa = new InstructionFactory(cGen);
		MethodGen methodGen = new MethodGen(Constants.ACC_STATIC, Type.VOID,
								new Type[] { Type.STRING },
								new String[] {"myString"}, "bcelsMethod", "HelloWorld", il, cPoolGen);
		
il.append(ifa.createNew("java.awt.Component"));
il.append(new PUSH(cPoolGen, "Hey"));
il.append(ifa.createInvoke("javax.swing.JOptionPane", "showMessageDialog", Type.VOID, new Type[]{ 
                                      new ObjectType("java.awt.Component") , 
                                     Type.STRING}, Constants.INVOKEVIRTUAL));
il.append(InstructionFactory.createReturn(Type.VOID));
methodGen.setMaxStack(30);
methodGen.setInstructionList(il);

Can anyone help please?

Read full topic
